Single Pole Toggle Switches.definition: Single pole traditional toggle style switches with flip-style actuators for basic on/off lighting control, e.g. standard toggle switches, grounding toggle switches, illuminated toggle switches, heavy duty toggle switches, toggle framed switches, commercial grade toggle switches

Single Pole Rocker Switches.definition: Single pole decorator/rocker style switches with paddle-style actuators for basic on/off lighting control, e.g. standard single pole rocker switches, decorator paddle switches, illuminated rocker switches, decorator rocker switches, paddle switches

Three Way Toggle Switches.definition: Three-way traditional toggle style switches for multi-location control from two different locations, e.g. three-way toggle switches

Three Way Rocker Switches.definition: Three-way decorator/rocker style switches for multi-location control from two different locations, e.g. three-way rocker switches, three-way decorator switches

Three Way Mixed Style Switches.definition: Three-way light switches designed for multi-location control from two different locations with mixed toggle and rocker actuator styles, e.g. 3-way toggle switches, 3-way rocker switches

Four Way Toggle Switches.definition: Four-way traditional toggle style switches for multi-location control from three or more locations, e.g. four-way toggle switches

Four Way Rocker Switches.definition: Four-way decorator/rocker style switches for multi-location control from three or more locations, e.g. four-way rocker switches, four-way decorator switches

Four Way Mixed Style Switches.definition: Four-way light switches designed for multi-location control from three or more locations with mixed decorator and paddle actuator styles, e.g. 4-way decorator switches, 4-way paddle switches

Multi Function Combination Switches.definition: Switches that combine multiple switching functions or integrate switch with outlet in a single device, e.g. duplex rocker switches, combination decorator switches, dual switches, switch outlet combinations, multi-function switches

High Amperage Rocker Switches.definition: Rocker switches rated for 20 amp or higher current loads for heavy duty applications, e.g. 20 amp rocker switches, commercial grade high current switches

Motion Sensor Switches.definition: Switches with built-in motion detection sensors for automatic operation based on occupancy, e.g. motion sensor switches, occupancy sensor switches, motion activated switches

Illuminated Indicator Switches.definition: Switches with built-in LED indicators or pilot lights for visual status indication, e.g. LED illuminated switches, pilot light switches, LED indicator switches, night light switches, locator light switches

WiFi Direct Smart Switches.definition: WiFi or wireless enabled switches that can be controlled remotely via smartphone apps, voice assistants, or home automation systems without requiring separate hub devices, e.g. smart light switches, connected switches, WiFi switches, smart home switches, app controlled switches, voice-activated switches

Wireless Remote Control Switches.definition: RF remote controlled switches without hardwired connections for wireless operation, e.g. wireless remote switches, RF controlled switches, wireless switch kits, battery-operated remote switches, RF remote switches

Hub Dependent Smart Switches.definition: Smart switches requiring separate hub devices for connectivity and automation protocols, e.g. Z-Wave switches, hub-dependent smart switches, protocol-based switches, Zigbee switches

Double Rocker Switches.definition: Switches with dual independent rocker controls in single housing for controlling two separate circuits, e.g. dual paddle switches, double decorator switches, twin rocker switches, duplex switches, combination double switches

Timer Control Switches.definition: Switches with built-in timing mechanisms for automatic scheduling and environmental sensors for specialized automated control functions, e.g. digital timer switches, programmable switches, astronomic timers, humidity sensor switches

Specialty Application Switches.definition: Switches designed for specific applications or environmental controls beyond standard lighting, e.g. ceiling fan switches, humidity sensor switches, wireless switches

High Amperage Transfer Switches.definition: High amperage switches for transferring electrical power between sources in emergency or backup power applications, e.g. emergency power transfer switches, non-fused transfer switches

Enhanced Feature Combination Switches.definition: Light switches combined with additional integrated features or controls in a single device beyond basic switching, e.g. switch with LED guide light, fan and light combination controls

Multi Way Auxiliary Switches.definition: Auxiliary switches designed to work with main switches in multi-way configurations as companion devices, e.g. add-on paddle switches, companion switches

Toggle Switches.definition: Light switches operated by a toggle mechanism that flips up and down, e.g. single-pole toggle switches, 4-way toggle switches, illuminated toggle switches

Rocker Switches.definition: Light switches with a flat paddle that rocks back and forth when pressed, e.g. decorator rocker switches, paddle switches, decora-style switches

Smart Switches.definition: Light switches with wireless connectivity and app control capabilities, e.g. WiFi switches, voice-controlled switches, app-controlled switches

Motion Sensor Switches.definition: Light switches that automatically turn lights on or off based on detected motion, e.g. occupancy sensors, motion-activated switches, auto-on switches

Night Light Switches.definition: Light switches with built-in LED illumination for visibility in dark conditions, e.g. illuminated switches, LED night light switches, lighted switches

Sound Activated Switches.definition: Light switches that respond to audio signals like clapping or voice commands, e.g. clap-on switches, sound detection switches, audio-controlled switches

Dimmer Switches.definition: Light switches that control the brightness level of connected lights, e.g. variable brightness controls, light intensity switches, dimming controls

Pilot Light Switches.definition: Light switches with indicator lights that show the on/off status of connected devices, e.g. combination switches with pilot lights, status indicator switches

Basic Single Pole Switches.definition: Standard on/off light switches for single circuit control, e.g. traditional wall switches, simple on/off switches, standard electrical switches
